image.altText: Man in hospital bed in blue gown, broken leg on the bed

props.synopsis: SA Health apologises to a man who spent nine days waiting for surgery at the Royal Adelaide Hospital after shattering his leg in a football game.

title.children: Footballer with broken leg waits nine days in hospital for surgery

image.altText: A beach along the Great Australian Bight.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the deaths of two women aged in their 60s whose bodies were recovered from the water after a search on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: Bodies of two women recovered after search off Streaky Bay

image.altText: An aerial view of the pellet plant at the Whyalla steelworks

props.synopsis: Amid ongoing legal action to wrest control of the Whyalla port from former steelworks owner GFG Alliance, the state government has moved to clarify the facility's ownership.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks port ownership dispute triggers law change

image.altText: A bald man with a brown goatie standing in front of a window

props.synopsis: The brother of an Australian man whose body was found at a beach on the island of Phuket says he appears to have run into trouble while swimming.

title.children: Australian man's death in Thailand likely a 'terrible accident'

image.altText: Tammy Franks looking stern in a pink blazer in front of microphones

props.synopsis: South Australian Greens politician Tammy Franks says she's resigning from the party and will sit as an independent until the next election.

title.children: SA Greens MP Tammy Franks resigns from party

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: The South Australian government invited some of the nation's top media and business executives to enjoy corporate hospitality at this year’s LIV Golf tournament, prompting questions about use of taxpayer funds.

title.children: FOI documents reveal 'boys club' guest list for exclusive LIV Golf suite

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: The High Court will today consider whether information gathered from encrypted messaging on an app known as AN0M, which was secretly controlled by the FBI and the Australian Federal Police, was legally obtained.

title.children: High Court to decide if information from encrypted app legally obtained

image.altText: An overpass going over a tunnel

props.synopsis: South Road was once the gateway to Adelaide's car industry, filtering hundreds of manufacturing workers into a suburban factory. But when that closed, the landscape changed. Now it's undergoing its biggest transformation yet.

title.children: A $15b road project is reshaping Adelaide's suburbs — will it be worth the price tag?

image.altText: A young boy site in a pram-like mobility aid

props.synopsis: A mother and her son with a disability waited two hours for an access taxi before a Good Samaritan drove them to an Adelaide hospital.

title.children: Truck driver picks up mother and son who waited hours for access taxi

image.altText: Boxes stacked up in a warehouse.

props.synopsis: Police say crime syndicates will be reeling after a vehicle search led to the discovery of a warehouse allegedly being used as a distribution centre for illegal tobacco products.

title.children: Police seize millions of cigarettes, tonnes of tobacco in SA raids

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: An internationally recognised fungi expert has described the accurate identification of death cap mushrooms as "challenging", resulting in people accidentally poisoning themselves.

title.children: Apps had 'poor' accuracy for picking poisonous mushrooms, trial hears

image.altText: Aman with greying hair stares at the camera

props.synopsis: The actor, 76, was accused of having groped a 54-year-old set dresser and a 34-year-old assistant during filming of Les Volets Verts (The Green Shutters).

title.children: French actor Gérard Depardieu convicted of sexual assault on film set

image.altText: Tents erected in a public park beneath an overcast sky.

props.synopsis: Rough sleepers in south-east Queensland have been dealt another blow with a third local government adopting a hardline stance on homelessness.

title.children: Gold Coast City Council endorses fining rough sleepers

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The trade war between the US and China isn't fully over, but a deal between the two sides to slash reciprocal tariffs is a major capitulation from Donald Trump.

title.children: No matter how he spins it, this is a major capitulation from Trump

image.altText: Man walks among blue and white cordoned-off tape

props.synopsis: British police say they have arrested a man on suspicion of arson after a fire broke out at UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's London house on Monday.

title.children: Man arrested on suspicion of arson after fire at Keir Starmer's London home

image.altText: A Kanak hunter from New Caledonia

props.synopsis: Firearms have been multiplying fast in the Pacific territory, where civil tensions remain unresolved over the question of independence from France.

title.children: New Caledonia is stockpiling guns like it is the United States

image.altText: Ellouisa Patricia Brighton and infant.

props.synopsis: Ellouisa Patricia Brighton, 36, remains in hospital in a critical condition after the fire at Merritt Street in Harristown last week.

title.children: Mother charged with murder after house fire that killed three children

image.altText: A woman rushing in a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the $2 billion residential care system finds children in three of the biggest states are being preyed upon by child sex abusers when they should be safe in state care.

title.children: Girl in 24/7 care 'so far gone' she may die from sexual exploitation

image.altText: A graphic depicting a map of the Northern Territory over a patterned background

props.synopsis: With net debt to soon surpass $12 billion, the Northern Territory government's latest budget is headlined by record funding for corrections but little for new infrastructure projects.

title.children: From prisons to roads and health: The NT budget's winners and losers

image.altText: A woman and a man in blazers look at budget papers on a desk.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's net debt will reach more than $12 billion next financial year, with the budget forecasting a further increase to nearly $14 billion by 2029.

title.children: The NT's debt is approaching $14b, the highest per capita in Australia

image.altText: A headshot of Diddy wearing a white suit, standing in front of a grey background

props.synopsis: The prosecution argues Sean "Diddy" Combs used his power to coerce victims into marathon drug-fuelled orgies, while the defence says its client is merely a "swinger" with unconventional sexual proclivities.

title.children: Sex worker tells of 'attack' on girlfriend on Diddy trial's first day

image.altText: Pencil sketch of Reagan Chown frowning in the dock of a courtroom.

props.synopsis: A car thief who was high on meth when he ran over a police officer after a chase through the streets of Perth is found guilty of killing him.

title.children: Car thief who ran over police officer guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: A man walks past two terrace houses

props.synopsis: Inflation is declining and global growth is under a cloud but feeding rate cuts into an already hot property market is likely to spark another buying frenzy and even higher prices. That could throw doubt on the RBA's ability to provide the number of cuts pencilled in for this year.

title.children: Why the Reserve Bank is wary of rocketing real estate prices

image.altText: Hostages protest

props.synopsis: It has been more than 580 days since 251 people were taken hostage by Hamas on October 7, 2023. Here's why the most recent release is significant.

title.children: What we know about the remaining hostages in Gaza

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: Several Legal Aid NT board members, including its chair, have resigned following the Attorney-General's "captain's pick" appointment to head up the embattled organisation.

title.children: NT government's 'captain's pick' for legal agency sparks multiple resignations

image.altText: two women, one holding a greens pamphlet, talk to media

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Watson-Brown has claimed Ryan in inner-Brisbane. She's the only Greens MP to retain their seat.

title.children: Larissa Waters won't rule out leadership tilt as Greens claim sole election victory

image.altText: A farmhouse surrounded by floodwater.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government says it will not enter a cost-sharing agreement with the Commonwealth to future-proof the homes of Rochester flood victims.

title.children: Rochester residents denied assistance to flood-proof homes

image.altText: anthony albanese points towards reporters outside parliament house in canberra

props.synopsis: The reshuffle announced by Anthony Albanese is a mix of continuity and change, with those in the government's top rank staying in their previous ministries.

title.children: Albanese shifts Plibersek from environment in favour of 'can-do' Watt

image.altText: A selfie of a man staring at a camera wearing a cap

props.synopsis: A jury hears a farm worker accused of murdering a man in western NSW confessed on three separate occasions.

title.children: Murder accused says alleged confessions were him 'being a d***head'

image.altText: Alan Jones outside Downing Centre local court in Sydney

props.synopsis: During a brief mention on Tuesday, a lawyer for the former broadcaster said the evidence was "blatantly contradictory" to allegations of historical indecent assault and sexual touching against his client.

title.children: 'Blatantly contradictory': Lawyer hits out at evidence against Alan Jones

image.altText: A man in a mitre 10 shirt looks ahead with a sad expression. He is standing a hardware store.

props.synopsis: There's little this hardware store owner can do to stop Bunnings building next door, but when rivals want to move in on the warehouse giant's turf, it is a different story.

title.children: Bunnings is moving next to David's hardware shop, there's little he can do

image.altText: A diesel train pulls into a station.

props.synopsis: Manufacturing powerhouse Downer has had a bid to overhaul the state's diesel tilt trains rejected, leaving 122 jobs hanging in the balance.

title.children: More than 120 jobs at risk after major proposal rejected in Queensland

image.altText: A generic photograph of an unidentified WA Police officer wearing a high visibility police vest over a blue uniform.

props.synopsis: WA Police wrongfully arrest a man twice after mistaking his identity on two separate occasions, a report by the state's corruption watchdog reveals.

title.children: Vulnerable man wrongly arrested twice after ID bungle

image.altText: A crumpled bicycle fitted with a motor lies in some dirt.

props.synopsis: A 68-year-old man has died after being struck by a bike with an electric motor taped to it that was believed to be travelling at high speeds on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula.

title.children: Man dies after being struck by illegally modified bicycle

image.altText: An actor dressed as Michael Jackson holding his hat with leg out in a signature Jackson dance move

props.synopsis: The Tony Award-winning musical production features three different actors playing Michael Jackson at different stages of his life.

title.children: Fans love it, but critics unhappy about what's not in MJ the Musical
